description: Command-line interface for Hela that allows operators to submit scans, select policies, configure scan sets, and download OAuth-protected reports over HTTP/2 + TLS1.3 while exposing depth/detectability/risk metadata.
steps: Define CLI commands (`hela scan`, `hela report`, `hela status`, `hela cancel`) that translate to the REST API over HTTP/2
Expose policy selection flags (`--policy=default|complete|deep|fast`) plus configurable scan set selection (`--set=`) referencing feature-scan-sets
Surface depth, detectability, target risk, and operator risk ratings in CLI prompts so users understand the impact of their selections
Implement OAuth2 Client Credentials token acquisition via config files
Wire CLI commands to call feature-rest-api endpoints and stream results
Document CLI usage in README/docs and validate via integration tests
acceptance_criteria: CLI only communicates over HTTP/2 w/TLS1.3 using OS-trusted certs
Policies and scan sets are selectable via command flags and documented
CLI surfaces depth/detectability/target risk/operator risk metadata for each invocation and enforces configured risk tolerances
CLI handles OAuth tokens from approved config paths and rejects localhost bindings
Report downloads are saved via signed URLs and require valid tokens
